revised_title: Pioneering Vertebrate Palaeontologist and Comparative Anatomist: The Life and Legacy of Francis Rex Parrington
tldr: This biographical memoir recounts the life and achievements of Francis Rex Parrington, a renowned vertebrate palaeontologist and comparative anatomist. Parrington made significant contributions to the field, including his research on various vertebrate classes and his establishment of a thriving research school in the Zoology Department at Cambridge. His passion for natural history and paleontology began at a young age, and he went on to participate in important paleontological expeditions, such as those to Tendaguru in Tanganyika and the South African Karoo. Parrington's work and influence continue to be felt in the field of vertebrate paleontology today.
